entries.content: Session started - reviewing last 2 sessions on Claude formatter work. Moti wants to continue work on the formatter system we built together.

Moti asked about file icon library we used. Found it: FileIconService using Iconify Web Component with VSCode icon set (1,400+ icons). Smart detection for file types by extension, command detection (git/npm/python), graceful emoji fallback. Preloaded globally at window.fileIconService.

Plan created for adding file icons to ClaudeFormatter inline code. Key insight: Inline code (`backticks`) is NOT implemented yet - this will add both inline code support AND file icon integration together. Architecture: Create InlineCodePatternHandler following existing pattern (BoldPatternHandler, HeaderPatternHandler), integrate FileIconService.getIconSync() for filename detection, inject icon HTML before code tag.

Important clarification from Moti: `<code>` tags are for CODE only, not filenames. When Claude shows `styles.css` in backticks, we want: icon + plain text (no code styling). Need to differentiate between actual code vs file references in backticks.

Revised plan: Use existing InlineFilePathProcessor pattern - files in backticks become clickable badges with icons (NOT code tags). Pattern: `styles.css` â†’ [icon]styles.css. Already have FileIconService integration, just need to detect file patterns in streaming ClaudeFormatter and output badge HTML instead of code tags.
